verses.verse: (A Psalm of Asaph.) God<WH430> takes<WH5324> His stand<WH5324> in His own congregation;<WH5712> He judges<WH8199> in the midst<WH7130> of the rulers.<WH430>
How<WH4970> long<WH5704> <WH4970> will you judge<WH8199> unjustly,<WH5766> And show<WH5375> partiality<WH6440> <WH5375> to the wicked<WH7563>? Selah.<WH5542>
Vindicate<WH8199> the weak<WH1800> and fatherless;<WH3490> Do<WH6663> justice<WH6663> to the afflicted<WH6041> and destitute.<WH7326>
Rescue<WH6403> the weak<WH1800> and needy;<WH34> Deliver<WH5337> [them] out of the hand<WH3027> of the wicked.<WH7563>
They do not know<WH3045> nor<WH3808> do they understand;<WH995> They walk<WH1980> about in darkness;<WH2825> All<WH3605> the foundations<WH4144> of the earth<WH776> are shaken.<WH4131>
I said,<WH559> "You are gods,<WH430> And all<WH3605> of you are sons<WH1121> of the Most<WH9411> High.<WH9411>
"Nevertheless<WH403> you will die<WH4191> like men,<WH120> And fall<WH5307> like [any] one<WH259> of the princes.<WH8269>"
Arise,<WH6965> O God,<WH430> judge<WH8199> the earth!<WH776> For it is Thou who dost possess<WH5157> all<WH3605> the nations.<WH1471>
